meanings.definition: Avoidance of a direct answer or action
meanings.sent1: When I asked for help, all I got was a runaround.
meanings.sent2: The company's runaround left me feeling frustrated.
meanings.sent3: Trying to get a clear response from them was like chasing my own tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: Her runaround was like a maze with no exit.
meanings.sent5: The runaround they gave me was like trying to catch a slippery fish.

meanings.definition: A series of evasive or misleading actions
meanings.sent1: His runaround made it hard to trust his intentions.
meanings.sent2: The politician's runaround confused the audience.
meanings.sent3: Their runaround dance around the truth was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The runaround of excuses was like a never-ending loop.
meanings.sent5: The runaround of lies was as tangled as a ball of yarn.

meanings.definition: To deceive or mislead someone by giving them the runaround
meanings.sent1: He tried to runaround the customer by avoiding their questions.
meanings.sent2: She decided to runaround her boss to buy more time.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to runaround the suspect to uncover the truth.
meanings.sent4: The scammer's plan was to runaround the authorities.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's goal was to runaround his victims with false promises.
